a.description: Defines a hyperlink that will take the user to a new page.

abbr.description: Defines an abbreviation. Used to give information to browsers and search engines.

address.description: Specifies author's contact address (electronic or mailing).

area.description: Defines a specific area inside an image-map. Must be inside a <map> tag.
area.example:
<p>Click the Top or Bottom of this image-map!</p>

<img src="assets/areaTopBottom.jpg" alt="topBottom" usemap="#basicMap">

<map name="basicMap">
<area shape="rect" alt="top" coords="0,0,200,100" href="assets/top.jpg">
<area shape="rect" alt="bottom" coords="100,0,200,200" href="assets/bottom.jpg">
</map>
area.result: Click the Top or Bottom of this image-map!

article.description: Defines an article in the document.
article.result:
This is the heading of the article

Here is some additional content underneath the header.

This is the second article

The content of the second article is this sentence.

aside.description: Defines content aside from the page content.
aside.result:
Here is some sample text in a paragraph tag.

This is some text inside an aside tag.

Here is another paragraph after the aside.

b.example: <b>This bolded text</b> is wrapped in the b tag.
b.result: This bolded text is wrapped in the b tag.

base.description: Defines the base URL for all relative URLs in a page.
base.result:
The base element specifies a base URL to use for all relative URLs in a document.

For example, this link will link directly to a specific page.

https://www.google.com/search?q=base

However, this link is only a relative URL. The base is set to a different website, which will redirect to a different host.

/search?q=base

bdi.description: Defines a part of text that might be formatted in a different direction from the other text.
bdi.example: <bdi>إذ الدمج يتعلّق به،, فعل الذود إعمار غرّة، أي. حين عن فبعد حكومة إنطلاق, أم تحرّك مشاركة الإتفاقية مكن, النزاع تزامناً الثقيلة ٣٠ بعد. هذه عن القادة الأولية الفرنسية, ٣٠ مما ومضى لغات, عرفها الدّفاع أم به،. بال عن كانتا اقتصادية.</bdi>
bdi.result: <bdi>إذ الدمج يتعلّق به،, فعل الذود إعمار غرّة، أي. حين عن فبعد حكومة إنطلاق, أم تحرّك مشاركة الإتفاقية مكن, النزاع تزامناً الثقيلة ٣٠ بعد. هذه عن القادة الأولية الفرنسية, ٣٠ مما ومضى لغات, عرفها الدّفاع أم به،. بال عن كانتا اقتصادية.</bdi>

bdo.description: Defines right-to-left or left-to-right text direction.
bdo.example:
<p><bdo dir="rtl"> RIGHT to LEFT</bdo></p>
<p><bdo dir="ltr"> LEFT to RIGHT</bdo></p>
bdo.result:
RIGHT to LEFT

LEFT to RIGHT

blockquote.description: Specifies a section of text quoted from another source.
blockquote.result: Welcome to Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia that anyone can edit.

body.result: The body is where you place various elements. Note that all tag-specific attributes for this tag has been made obsolete.

br.example: Before the line break.<br /> After the line break.
br.result:
Before the line break.
After the line break.

canvas.description: Creates a space on which scripts can draw objects.
canvas.result:
<canvas id="boxCanvas">This blue box does not show if the browers does not support the canvas tag.</canvas>
<script>
  var c = document.getElementById("boxCanvas");
  var ctx = c.getContext("2d");
  ctx.fillStyle = "#0000FF";
  ctx.fillRect(0, 0, 150, 150);
</script>

caption.result:
The caption element is used within a table element to provide context.

This is a table.
Column 1 Column 2
Footer 1 Footer 2
Cell 1 Cell 2

cite.description: Declares the title of an external piece of work.
cite.example: <cite>This text has been affected by the cite tag.</cite>
cite.result: <cite>This text has been affected by the cite tag.</cite>

code.description: Defines a piece of computer code.
code.example: <code>This is an example of the code tag in use. It is used to denote computer code.</code>
code.result: This is an example of the code tag in use. It is used to denote computer code.

colgroup.description: Specifies a group of columns in a table.

data.description: Allows for machine-readable data to be provided.

datalist.result: Select your favorite color from the list below:

dd.description: Defines a description of a term in a description list.
dd.result:
The dd tag encloses the definition in a DL list.

Word
Definition

del.description: Defines text that has been deleted from a document.

details.result:
This is an example of a details element, click it to reveal hidden message.

- Hidden Message, much creative such secretive.

Much secrets can be hidden here.

This is an example of details element that is open by default with the open attribute

Hidden message of secrecy.

dfn.description: Specifies the defining instance of a term.
dfn.example: The DFN tag marks the the first instance of an <dfn title="Definition of element">element</dfn>, and points to a definition.
dfn.result: The DFN tag marks the the first instance of an <dfn title="Definition of element">element</dfn>, and points to a definition.

dialog.description: Specifies that part of an application is interactive.
dialog.example: <dialog open><p>This is an example of a dialog element.</p></dialog>
dialog.result: This is an example of a dialog element.

div.description: Defines a division or section within a doc. Usually for CSS.
div.example: <div style="background-color:yellow;">  <p>This section has a yellow background color.</p></div>
div.result: This section has a yellow background color.

dl.result:
The dl tag encloses a list of pairs of terms and descriptions.

Word
Definition

dt.description: Defines a term in a description list.
dt.result:
The dt tag encloses the term in a DL list.

Word
Definition

em.example: <em>This is an example of emphasized text using the em tag.</em>
em.result: This is an example of emphasized text using the em tag.

embed.description: Specifies external application or interactive content.

fieldset.description: Defines a group of related elements in a form.

figcaption.description: Specifies caption for the figure element.

figure.description: Specifies a group of media content, and their caption.

footer.description: Specifies a footer for a section or page.
footer.result:
This is the footer of the document.

The author of this article is Dennis Bykkov

Additional links to other content should be placed here.

form.description: Defines a form for user input.
form.result:
First Name:
Last Name:
E-Mail:

h1>, <h2>, <h3>, <h4>, <h5>, <h6.description: Headings of varying sizes, h1 (largest) to h6 (smallest).

header.description: Specifies a group of introductory or navigational aids, including hgroup elements.

hgroup.description: Specifies a header for a section or page.

hr.description: Inserts a line across the page, usually to indicate a change in content.

html.description: Defines the root of the HTML document.

i.description: Defines text of a differtent voice or mood.

label.description: Defines the label for an input element.

li.description: Defines a term in a list.

link.description: Defines a link between this document and an external resource.

main.description: Specifies the main content area of an HTML document.

meta.description: Defines metadata for the document; not displayed.

meter.description: Specifies measurement within a predefined range.

optgroup.description: Defines options that can be grouped together in a drop-down list.

option.description: Defines an option in a drop-down list.

output.description: Defines the result of a calculation.

param.description: Defines a parameter for an object.

progress.description: Defines the progress of a task.

q.example: <q>The tag represents quoted text and the browser will add quotes by default.</q>
q.result: <q>The tag represents quoted text and the browser will add quotes by default.</q>

rb.description: Defines the base of a ruby annotation.

rp.description: Specifies text to show for browsers that do not support ruby annotations.

rtc.description: Defines a text container for ruby annotations.

ruby.description: Defines a segment of text for ruby annotations.

samp.description: Defines a sample output from a program.

section.description: Defines a section in a document.

span.description: Defines a section in a document.

style.description: Defines style information, usually used for CSS.

summary.description: Defines a heading for a <details> element.

tbody.description: Specifies the body content of a table.
tbody.example: <table style="border: 1px solid black;"> <thead> <tr> <th>Column 1</th> <th>Column 2</th> </tr> </thead> <tbody> <tr> <td>td cell 1, child of tbody element</td> <td>td cell 2, child of tbody element</td> </tr> </tbody> <tfoot> <tr> <td>td cell 1, child of tfoot element</td> <td>td cell 2, child of tfoot element</td> </tr> </tfoot> </table>
tbody.result:
Column 1 Column 2
td cell 1, child of tbody element td cell 2, child of tbody element
td cell 1, child of tfoot element td cell 2, child of tfoot element

td.description: Defines table data that will appear in a cell in the table.
td.example: <table style="border: 1px solid black;"> <thead> <tr> <th>Column 1</th> <th>Column 2</th> </tr> </thead> <tfoot> <tr> <td>td cell 1, child of tfoot element</td> <td>td cell 2, child of tfoot element</td> </tr> </tfoot> <tbody> <tr> <td>td cell 1, child of tbody element</td> <td>td cell 2, child of tbody element</td> </tr> </tbody> </table>
td.result:
Column 1 Column 2
td cell 1, child of tfoot element td cell 2, child of tfoot element
td cell 1, child of tbody element td cell 2, child of tbody element

template.description: Declares HTML fragments that can be cloned and inserted in the document by script.
template.example: <template>This is the content in the template tag.</template>
template.result: <template>This is the content in the template tag.</template>

tfoot.description: Specifies footer content for a table.
tfoot.example: <table style="border: 1px solid black;"> <thead> <tr> <th>Column 1</th> <th>Column 2</th> </tr> </thead> <tbody> <tr> <td>td cell 1, child of tbody element</td> <td>td cell 2, child of tbody element</td> </tr> </tbody> <tfoot> <tr> <td>td cell 1, child of tfoot element</td> <td>td cell 2, child of tfoot element</td> </tr> </tfoot> </table>
tfoot.result:
Column 1 Column 2
td cell 1, child of tbody element td cell 2, child of tbody element
td cell 1, child of tfoot element td cell 2, child of tfoot element

th.description: Specifies a header cell in a table.
th.example: <table style="border: 1px solid black;"> <thead> <tr> <th>Header Cell 1</th> <th>Header Cell 2</th> </tr> </thead> <tbody> <tr> <td>Body Cell</td> <td>Body Cell</td> </tr> </tbody> <tfoot> <tr> <td>Footer Cell</td> <td>Footer Cell</td> </tr> </tfoot> </table>
th.result:
Header Cell 1 Header Cell 2
Body Cell Body Cell
Footer Cell Footer Cell

thead.description: Groups the header content in a table.
thead.example: <table style="border: 1px solid black;"> <thead> <tr> <th>Column 1</th> <th>Column 2</th> </tr> </thead> <tbody> <tr> <td>td cell 1, child of tbody element</td> <td>td cell 2, child of tbody element</td> </tr> </tbody> <tfoot> <tr> <td>td cell 1, child of tfoot element</td> <td>td cell 2, child of tfoot element</td> </tr> </tfoot> </table>

Column 1Column 2
td cell 1, child of tbody elementtd cell 2, child of tbody element

title.description: Defines the title for the document.
title.result: Note that the title appears on the tab of a browser, so no practical result will be placed.

tr.description: Specifies a row in the table.

track.description: Specifies a text track for media such as video and audio.
track.example: <video controls> <source src="assets/jellies.mp4" type="video/mp4"> <track kind="subtitles" src="assets/jellies.vtt" srclang="en" label="English"> </video>
track.result: <video controls> <source src="assets/jellies.mp4" type="video/mp4"> <track kind="subtitles" src="assets/jellies.vtt" srclang="en" label="English"> </video>

u.example: <u>This is example of underlined text using the u tag.</u>
u.result: <u>This is example of underlined text using the u tag.</u>

var.example: <var>x</var> <p>This is an example of a var tag in use, it is used to differentiate between variables and regular text.</p>
var.result:
x

This is an example of a var tag in use, it is used to differentiate between variables and regular text.

wbr.description: Specifies a line break opportunity for very long words and strings of text with no spaces.
